item.title: How to run dockerized Rstudio server on google cloud
item.description: Create a google VM Follow the process using the console https://cloud.google.com/compute/docs/instances/create-start-instance#console_1 Install docker Follow https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/debian/ Note this example for the debian build. If you created your VM using ubuntu as the boot disk, you should follow the ubuntu section https://docs.docker.com/engine/install/ubuntu/. In the GCP VM: sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get install \ ca-certificates \ curl \ gnupg \ lsb-release sudo mkdir -p /etc/apt/keyrings curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/debian/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /etc/apt/keyrings/docker.

item.title: Run Rstudio server with singularity on HPC
item.description: Background Please read the following before go ahead: what is docker? what is Rocker? what is singularity? from Harvard Research computing website: Odyssey has singularity installed. Why Singularity? There are some important differences between Docker and Singularity: Docker and Singularity have their own container formats. Docker containers may be imported to run via Singularity. Docker containers need root privileges for full functionality which is not suitable for a shared HPC environment.
